entry.title: Cleared document through H2H is going in payment block in FBL1N in SAP 1909
entry.content: Cleared document through H2H is going in payment block in FBL1N in SAP 1909. Once the payment is cleared then such document should not be in payment block

entry.title: Is debit is '+' and credit is '-' is same in SAP SD & SAP MM ECC & S/4 HANA?
Where does value help for Purchaser Responsible come from in Purchasing category App ?
entry.content:
hello 

In the Manage Purchasing Categories app , the Purchaser Responsible field only shows a few Business Partners ‚Äî not all employees.

We‚Äôve already checked that:

All missing BPs are of type Person, have role Employee (BUP003), and are linked to Personnel Numbers.

HR integration is active.

So where does the app read the possible values for this field from?

entry.title: Clarification on HANA Runtime compliance
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community,

I am seeking clarification on two related topics regarding SAP Document and Reporting Compliance (DRC) and SAP HANA Runtime licensing.

Scenario:

  • Customer runs SAP S/4HANA with HANA Runtime Edition for Applications & BW.
  • The customer does not have a DRC subscription.
  • A certified third-party Peppol Access Point is used for sending and receiving electronic invoices (XRechnung / Peppol).
  • The integration add-on runs entirely within the SAP application layer (ABAP), using standard IDoc/BAPI/RFC/Proxy interfaces ‚Äî no direct database access, no XS, no SQL scripts, and no custom tables in HANA.

Questions:

  1. Is such an add-on architecture compliant under HANA Runtime licensing, or would it require a Full Use Edition?
  2. For outbound e-invoicing (XRechnung/Peppol), is SAP DRC mandatory, or can a third-party Access Point be used directly with standard SAP interfaces?

If possible, I would appreciate an SAP Note reference or official clarification on these points to help guide the architecture decision.

Thank you in advance for your insights.

entry.title: F110 XML file tags Intermediary Bank, Clearing Code, and FX Contract
entry.content:
We are currently implementing XML file uploads with the banks, and they require SAP fields corresponding to the following tags: Intermediary Bank, Clearing Code, and FX Contract.

Could anyone please advise which source tables or fields in SAP we should use to populate these tags?

entry.title: Can not restore SAP HANA 1.0 SP12 COMPLETE_DATA_BACKUP to other server
entry.content:
Hello,

I can not restore COMPLETE_DATA_BACKUP backup from server-db1 to server-db2.

Here is my command

hdbadm@hanadb-01:/usr/sap/HDB/HDB00> HDBSettings.sh recoverSys.py --command="RECOVER DATA USING FILE ('/tmp/data/COMPLETE_DATA_BACKUP_20251016') CLEAR LOG"
[139778227181312, 0.002] >> starting recoverSys (at Thu Oct 16 16:27:49 2025)
[139778227181312, 0.002] args: ()
[139778227181312, 0.002] keys: {'command': "RECOVER DATA USING FILE ('/tmp/data/COMPLETE_DATA_BACKUP_20251016') CLEAR LOG"}
own pid: 24280
recoverSys started: ============2025-10-16 16:27:49 ============
testing master: hanadb-01
hanadb-01 is master
shutdown database, timeout is 120
stop system
stop system: hanadb-01
stopping system: 2025-10-16 16:27:49
stopped system: 2025-10-16 16:28:10
creating file recoverInstance.sql
restart database
restart master nameserver: 2025-10-16 16:28:15
start system: hanadb-01
2025-10-16T16:28:24+07:00 P024490 199ec595262 INFO RECOVERY state of service: nameserver, hanadb-01:30001, volume: 1, RecoveryPrepared

recoverSys finished successfully: 2025-10-16 16:28:25
[139778227181312, 36.087] 0
[139778227181312, 36.087] << ending recoverSys, rc = 0 (RC_TEST_OK), after 36.085 secs

Process run very fast and not working

Sorry for my english, Please help

Binh

entry.title: SNOTE: Unknown object type (WDYA)
entry.content:
Hi experts,

I am implementing these notes: 3565339 - ODN Framework - Note Collection.

S4CORE: 106, SAP_BASIS: 756

Where I am getting the error is in this one: 3593722 - ODN Framework - BRF FPM Application.

It seems that SNOTE is not understanding the WDYA type (FPM Application) and it is not creating it:

I tried to implement it in another system (S4CORE: 107, SAP_BASIS: 757), and it is doing it fine:

How can I fix it?
Thanks in advance for the replies!

entry.title: Need Support on RAP application
entry.content:
Hello Guys,

good morning!

I need help on RAP Application.

we have created new RAP application for vendor campaign it involves 3 levels.

1. Campaign Header:  Campaign ID, Key date , Campaign Start date and Campaign End Date.

2. Campaign Items: Campaign ID , Comapny Code, Supplier.

3. Supplier Open Items: Supplier , Document Number , Item and amount.

Now we have requirement to create new multiple campaign items in single click.

we are able to create new single campaign item using abstract entity and action.

but we are not able achieve/select multiple supplier in abstract entity to select multiple and create multiple campaign items in single click.

In abstract entity, we can select only one supplier at a time. We should be able to select multiple supplier.

Could you please assist?

thanks for your support in advance.

regards,

Pramodh

entry.title: Connection Issue Between SAP BTP Trial and S/4HANA On-Premise via Cloud Connector
entry.content:
Hi All,

I‚Äôm currently configuring the connectivity between our SAP BTP free trial account and our S/4HANA on-premise system using the Cloud Connector. After completing the setup, I tried to validate the connection between the cloud and on-premise systems, but I encountered an error.

Upon checking the related SAP Note, it seems that the issue might be due to a possible spelling mistake in the host name or a connectivity issue with the internal host.

I have verified that the internal hostname and port are correct, and I also checked in SICF in on-premise system to ensure the correct internal host and port are maintained. However, the connection is still not working. I‚Äôm using an HTTPS connection.

Could you please help me resolve this issue?

BR/Kannan.

entry.title: EU Triangular Trading workaround for intercompany invoice
entry.content:
Hi experts!

We have the following scenario in regards of triangular trading for which we need a solution for the intercompany invoices:

We order products in company code XX01 (Danish entity) with an external supplier SUP01 in Czech Republic. We want the products to be delivered to our 3PL distribution center in a different company code XX02 (German entity). Therefore we would have two invoices related to the same PO:

  • The supplier SUP01 should invoice company code XX01 and deliver the goods to company code XX02
  • And then we would need intercompany billing to happen between XX01 and XX02 company codes for these products. (were XX1 is acting as the "supplier" and XX02 is acting as the "buyer")

How could we setup such scenario? Has anyone had a similar situation?

Best regards,

Natalie

entry.title: BAPI_PROCORDCONF_CREATE_TT does not show errors if no stock available (nor COGI!?)
entry.content:
Dear Experts

 

We have been using  co6n and for a long time and it works properly. I am trying to use the bapi BAPI_PROCORDCONF_CREATE_TT to do the same, mostly consumption of materials, in case there is an error (stock is not enough for instance) the movement should go to COGI. We use SP HANA since 2024.

I am testing in Se37 with a test sequence of BAPI_PROCORDCONF_CREATE_TT and later BAPI_TRANSACTION_COMMIT with the "X"

I started with a simple entry in tables TIMETICKETS (record with confirmation number and little more, no yield) GOODSMOVEMENTS and also LINK_CONF_GOODSMOV table.

When I do a confirmation with a simple good movement of 1 unit (I have 10.000 in stock in my test system) all goes well apparently. At least the movement 261 is shown in MB51 and the confirmation is recorded. Only it‚Äôs a bit weird that in CORT I do not see the movement attached to the confirmation but for the rest, even the reservation is reduced etc.

The trouble is when I test a wrong movement to create a COGI or ‚Äúsome error‚Äù. For instance I enter quantity 999999 in the BAPI to create a cogi.

I get no error or message in BAPI, even it says that the confirmation has been saved. Later after commit, nothing happens.

If I do a similar thing in the same order, it goes to COGI.

SO I am a bit confused üòû

Best Regards

Yanik

entry.title: Filtering Cost Centers by Employee Division/Org Unit in Time Entry Profile
entry.content:
Hi SAP Community,

I‚Äôm working in an SAP S/4HANA system and need help understanding how to filter cost centers in the Time Entry Profile based on the division the employee belongs to.

The goal is to ensure that when employees enter their time, they only see cost centers relevant to their division. I suspect this involves configuration within the Time Entry Profile, possibly tied to organizational assignments or custom logic, but I‚Äôm unclear on the exact steps.

Has anyone implemented this kind of filtering in S/4HANA? If so:

  • What configuration steps are required?
  • Is there a standard way to link cost centers to divisions dynamically?
  • Would this require custom logic (e.g., BAdIs, business rules, or enhancements)?
  • Are there any limitations or best practices to consider?

Any guidance, examples, or documentation references would be greatly appreciated!

Thanks in advance,
Thanooja

entry.title: Employee replication with inactive cost center assignment
entry.content:
Currently we have implemented Org and Employee replication from SuccessFactors to S/4 Hana mini master.  We had a company restructure and during that restructure the finance department has locked all their old cost centers as of 01/01/1900.  Now when replication occurs on rehires the s/4 system errors out saying

Cost center 1000/50004309 blocked against direct postings on 02/14/2023

I asked for finance to utilize validity periods for their cost centers, for our company that is not currently an option. This occurs in both SFEC and S4 (cost centers are passed to SFEC from S4 with the inactivation date of 01/01/1900 when locked)

1- Is there a work around, BADI, anything I can do on the HR side to stop the errors and complete replication for positions and employees in S4?

2- Are there any options in SuccessFactors to be able to edit on retro entries in job portlet with inactive cost centers.

Thank you for any advice.

entry.title: monthly transactional database growth details
entry.content:
Hello SAP Team,

I am able to retrieve the overall database growth details from DB02. Please find below the summary of our SAP HANA database growth for the last 10 months (Jan-2025 to Oct-2025):

DescriptionDetails

Total Database Growth (10 Months)386.28 GBAverage Database Growth per Month~40 GB

However, I am unable to get the month-wise growth details specifically for the Transactional Database.

I have already referred to the following SAP Notes but could not find any suitable script or guidance to extract the monthly transactional data growth:

  • SAP Note 2680392 ‚Äì How to monitor HANA Database growth history for more than 42 days

  • SAP Note 1969700 ‚Äì Monitoring HANA database size and growth using SQL queries

Kindly advise on how to get the monthly transactional database growth details ‚Äî either through any SQL script, system view, or standard report available in HANA Studio or DBACOCKPIT.

Please suggest if there‚Äôs an SAP-provided method or note that covers this requirement.

Thanks

entry.title: Best approach to migrate 1M Customers & Vendors from ECC to BP in S/4HANA ‚Äì DMC vs CVI?
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

We are preparing a migration from SAP ECC to SAP S/4HANA and we have approx. 1 million customer and vendor records that must be converted to Business Partners (BP).

We are evaluating the best migration approach and would like input from the community:

Has anyone successfully migrated a very large volume of customers and vendors directly via Data Migration Cockpit (DMC)?

Has anyone enabled CVI (Customer Vendor Integration) in ECC first, converted the master data there, and then migrated only balances / open items to S/4HANA?

For high volumes (1M+ business partners), what is the recommended best practice according to your experience?

Key questions we are trying to answer:

Is it more stable to activate CVI in ECC and synchronize customers/vendors to BP before the migration?

Does DMC scale efficiently for this volume of business partner creation?

Any lessons learned, performance considerations, or pitfalls to avoid?

Any guidance, experience sharing, or official SAP recommendations would be highly appreciated.

Thank you!
